data.title: good pizza
data.text: Used to go to Twiggs when it was in Lake Zurich, pre fire, It was the best pizza around. This new location lacks the ambiance, pizza is still pretty good.

data.title: Life altering thin crust
data.text: Used to TripAdvisor to find it now I'm using it to plug it. Awesome thin crust go with the VIP. Real good wings. The server was clearly in love with the buffalo sauce so we gave them a go and they were very good. He also suggested the buffalo sauce on the pizza or an Italian beef. He might drink it, but it was really good. Would return.

data.title: Thin Crust Heaven
data.text:
Buffalo sauce was recommended so we tried the wings.  Flavor and heat were good.

Thin crust:

1/2 VIP (solid), 1/2 veggie.

Great taste and the garlic wasn't overpowering.  The veggie I made just too change it up was ok, but nothing like the VIP.  No wait, great place, would be a regular hang out for me if I lived here.

data.title: Pizza Pub, laid back atmosphere
data.text: Pizza is great.  They have buckets of beer at a special price.  Peanuts at the table.  A great place to go with the family, they have a game room for the kids, they don't mind them moving around.

data.title: GREAT PLACE
data.text: Staff is Real friendly and Food is TERRIFIC !!! Picked up 4 different styles and everyone was cooked perfect. If you have never been there, you MUST try it

data.title: Fun Place, Good Pizza
data.text: Very family-friendly atmosphere, but adult groups are comfortable. Thin crust pizza is very good. Booth seating for the mostpart.

data.title: Hasn't Changed!
data.text:
what can I say? I grew up with it and would know the taste of their pizza anywhere. Granted, growing up, we went to a different location that burned down long ago, but the food at this location is identical in every way. This is the epitome of the Midwestern pizza place…and while they have sandwiches, a few entrees and some pasta, make no mistake, you come here for pizza.

There is a dizzying array of appetizers, mostly the fried basket of the day ranging from breaded mushrooms (which will burn your mouth at 1500 degrees C), to fried cheese, onion rings and the like.

They have pretty simple salads reminiscent of 1987 with iceberg lettuce, tomato, red onion etc served with one of your standard dressings…

But it is the pizza….maybe it is because I grew up with it, maybe because it is just good pizza….from the crust to the sauce…it is made in-house and is unique. We always get the thin crust which is cut into squares….I believe they have other doughs though….but the thin crust is what we have always gotten. I live out of their delivery range, but every now and then I will order it and go there to pick it up…when I do, I am 9 years old again. 

Let’s face it…you have all these sick little pizza chains that charge you four hundred dollars for a pizza – the crust is usually cardboard and they aren’t very good – Twiggs will keep you coming back because it is GOOD!!!

data.title: A rainy night with pizza
data.text: J J Twigs is our favorite place for pizza. Saturday night was no exception. The service was good, the pizza was very tasty and the beer was cold. You can't ask for a better combination. I would recommend Twigs to anyone who enjoys good pizza at a reasonable price.

data.title: Great Little Place
data.text: After reading reviews we decided to try this place in downtown Palatine. This is a smaller yet spacious restaurant. Staff was very friendly and service was good. We tried the buffalo wings, meatball pizza and the Italian beef pizza. Wings were typical but good. Although they are not Jumbo wings. The pizza though is excellent. We will be back for sure.

data.title: DELICIOUS!
data.text:
JJ's pizza is fantastic! The ingredients are fresh and the crust is amazing! We keep be the double-dough pizza since we are "Chicagoans" and like our crust thick. The thin crust pizza is very good, too. 
You will not regret ordering a JJ's pizza!!!

data.title: Ok Service, OK Pizza
data.text: The pizza was ok, but nothing to impressive, the service was slow for a not so busy night, but everything was edible, and I would visit again for the root beer beer.

data.title: Great place for pizza!
data.text: Really good pizza and sides of appetizers,you can also enjoy beer or buckets at a reasonable price. They dont have a lot of seating so the place can fill up fast. They have parking.

data.title: be careful
data.text: excessive noise. asked staff to get some guests to lower their volumn but staff did not care and did not do anything   we have been here many times. but it is in the pits now. we will never visit this eatery ever again

data.title: Low Key place - good pizza
data.text:
I've been here a few times.  It is a small place focusing basically on pizza.  Their specialty is a double-decker pizza which is probably what you think.  One thin crust pizza with another piled on top of it.  I like the fact they serve this in triangles so you can hold on to the crust at the end.  So many places around here do squares, and for cheesy pizzas such as Twigs get to be a real mess.  Anyway... if you like thin crust - but want more "fixings" than usual - the double-decker is a unique option

Toppings are fresh and plentiful.  Lots of cheese.  Very good fare.  Reasonably priced.  Easy place to find; on the curve of Northwest Highway on the SE side of Palatine.

I've found service to be on the slow side, albeit friendly and accommodating.  TV screens throughout - Food Network was on!

data.title: Stopped by for some pizza and pitcher of beer.
data.text: The beer was cold, the decor was that of an old-school pizza place (which I liked), but the pizza was just so-so. I hope that it was just an off day.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: This is really good thin crust pizza. Had it delivered and arrived hot in their portable pizza warmer.  Loved it. All the flavors came together beautifully.  Cheese good sauce good sausage.

data.title: Neighborhood pizza join
data.text: Our family loves the pizza here. Crispy thin crust and fresh toppings. Dine in or carry out, both options yield the same delicious results.

data.title: Good pizza at a descent price!
data.text: A nice place to bring the family. Just a simple sit down pizza restaurant. They also offer drinks and beer specials.

data.title: One of our favorite local pizza places
data.text: Great pizza.  Loaded with cheese and toppings.  Staff are always friendly and while delivery takes a while, they are always hot and great pizza.

data.title: Suprise
data.text: This place is a converted 'dog and suds' from 40 years ago. Small and redone so you might not expect much.  But according to seniors eating there for lunch, it is the best pizza in Palatine.  The owner gave me a tour and could not have been more hospitable.  Eat in or carry out, get ready for a surprise.  This place is a gem. Thin crust and superb.
